ref.mixed-citation: Bernstein, R. (1977). The restructuring of social and political theory. Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania.
Foucault, M. (1978). The history of sexuality. Vol 1. New York: Vintage.
Gadamer, H.-G. (1981). Reason in the age of science. Trans. by F.G. Lawrence. Cambridge: MIT Press.
Gadamer, H.-G. (1988). Truth and method. Trans. by G. Barden and J. Cumming. New York: Crossroad.
Gadamer, H.-G. (1990). Reply to my critics. In G. Ormiston and A. Schrift (Eds.), The hermeneutic tradition: From Ast to Ricoeur, 273-297. Albany: State University of New York.
Geertz, C. (1973). The interpretation of culture. New York: Basic.
Giddens, A. (1979). Central problems in social theory. Berkeley: University of California.
Habermas, J. (1971). Knowledge and human interests. Trans. by J. Shapiro. Boston: Beacon.
Habermas, J. (1977). A review of Gadamer's 'Truth and Method'. In F. Dallmayr and T. McCarthy (Eds.), Understanding and social inquiry, 335-363. Notre Dame, IN: University of Notre Dame.
Habermas, J. (1984). The theory of communicative action, Vol. 1, Trans. by T. McCarthy. Boston: Beacon.
Habermas, J. (1988). On the logic of social sciences. Trans. by S. Weber Nicholsen and J.A. Stark. Cambridge: MIT Press.
Habermas, J. (1990). The hermeneutic claim to universality. In G. Ormiston and A. Schrift (Eds.), The hermeneutic tradition: From Ast to Ricoeur, 245-272. Notre Dame, IN: University of Notre Dame.
Huspek, M. (1989/1990). The idea of ethnography and its relation to cultural critique. Research on Language and Social Action 23:293-312.
Huspek, M. (1991). Taking aim at Habermas's critical theory. Communication Monographs 58:225-233.
Huspek, M. (1993a). Dueling structures: The theory of resistance in discourse. Communication Theory 3(1):1-25.

Huspek, M. (1993b). Nonfoundational and critical analyses: Are they contradictory or complementary? In B. Kovacik (Ed.), Communication and the transformation of modern organizational life, in press. Albany: State University of New York.
Huspek, M. (1993c). Oppositional codes and social class relations. British Journal of Sociology, in press.
Huspek, M. and Rincon, O. (1993). Antiscience: On Foucault's discourse on Otherness. Unpublished manuscript.
Warnke, G. (1987). Gadamer: Hermeneutics, tradition and reason. Stanford: Stanford University Press.
Winch, P. (1958). The idea of social science and its relation to philosophy. London: Routledge and Kegan Paul.
Winch, P. (1977). Understanding a primitive society. In F. Dallmayr and T. McCarthy (Eds.), Understanding and social inquiry, 159-188. Notre Dame, IN: University of Notre Dame Press.
